intro: Phlomoides milkoi, commonly known as the milkweed phlomis, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Phlomoides milkoi is adapted to drought conditions and is often found growing in rocky soils and open habitats.
